meanings.definition: Having a tendency to dip or sink
meanings.sent1: The boat was dippier than expected, causing it to sway in the water.
meanings.sent2: The wet sponge felt dippier as it absorbed more liquid.
meanings.sent3: The dippier puddle seemed to be calling out for more rain to join it.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was dippier than a sinking ship, slowly descending into sadness.
meanings.sent5: The dippier sandcastle crumbled under the weight of the waves.

meanings.definition: More foolish or eccentric than usual
meanings.sent1: His dippier ideas often led to unexpected outcomes.
meanings.sent2: The dippier behavior of the clown entertained the children at the party.
meanings.sent3: The dippier hat he wore made everyone smile with its silliness.
meanings.sent4: She had a dippier way of looking at the world, seeing magic in everyday things.
meanings.sent5: The dippier dance moves of the penguin brought joy to all who watched.
